subject: Productivity
title: Sleep and Habit Formation
description: One-minute skill: Sleep and Habit Formation.

hook.text: Students who slept well after practice remembered the skill better the next day.

buildup.text: Sleep consolidates memories, including the motor and cognitive patterns behind habits.

discovery.text: During deep sleep, the brain replays the day's actions, strengthening newly formed neural paths.

twist.text: Sleep deprivation weakens self-control and boosts impulsive habits. One bad night undoes days of effort.

climax.text: Building new habits without enough sleep is like planting seeds in dry soil.

punchline.text: Sleep is when habits actually take root.

quiz.question: How does sleep affect habit formation?
options: It consolidates and strengthens newly formed neural paths
It erases all habits formed during the day
It has no measurable effect on habits
